page.title: 17CUSTOMS AT TEVIOTHEAD
page.content: TWICE ANNUALLY AND PRIOR TO THE COMMON RIDING CELEBRATIONS HELD IN HAWICK,A CAVALCADE OF'MALE EQUESTRIAN SUPPORTERS' LED BY THE HAWICK CORNET ,RIDES THROUGH THE TEVIOTHEAD SECTION TO VISIT THE HOTEL AT MOSSPAUL.THE ROUTE IS FOLLOWED OVER STEEP HILLS AND BOGGY GROUND IN THE FOOTSTEPS OF THE OLD MOSSTROOPERS BY COLTERSCLEUCHSHIEL (SOUTHDEANRIG SHIEL) TO PHAUP.THIS PART OF THE ROUTE IS CONFINED TO HIGHER GROUND WHERE SHEEP AND CATTLE GRAZE,WHICH IS EXCELLENT FOR HUNTING,AND IN FACT,IS USED BY THE LIDDESDALE HUNT.THIS CUSTOM HAS BEEN CARRIED OUT SINCE 1901 WHEN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE HOTEL GAVE THE FIRST INVITATION.
